definition: day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
(negative prefix for verbs)/have not/not
drowned/to end/to die/to inundate
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
(negative prefix for verbs)/have not/not
drowned/to end/to die/to inundate
night
variant of 夜[ye4]

sentences.english: I don't want to work day and night, I just want to be a campus drifter.
sentences.chinese: 我不想没日没夜地工作，只想做个校漂族。

sentences.english: Consoling a colicky baby night after night is terribly hard.
sentences.chinese: 没日没夜的照顾小闹腾非常的辛苦。

sentences.english: Stayin up for days in the chelsea hotel.
sentences.chinese: 在切尔西饭店没日没夜的那几天。

sentences.english: Stayin' up for days in the Chelsea Hotel.
sentences.chinese: 在切尔西饭店没日没夜的这些天里。

sentences.english: YouBin care day and night, she recognised.
sentences.chinese: 尤斌没日没夜悉心照顾，得到周母认可。

sentences.english: The noise produced by cars day and night disturbs people's daily life.
sentences.chinese: 私家车没日没夜地制造噪音干扰人们的生活。

sentences.english: The telex chattered all day and night with news bulletins.
sentences.chinese: 电传机没日没夜“嗒嗒嗒”地接收新闻稿。

sentences.english: Sunset night thoughts, has turned to be missed.
sentences.chinese: 没日没夜的，已变成怀念。

sentences.english: First they chatted on Net, days and nights.
sentences.chinese: 先只是聊天，没日没夜地聊。

sentences.english: Without anything to do, he played computer games all day.
sentences.chinese: 无所事事，他只能打游戏，没日没夜。

sentences.english: A whole have their own like a gyroscope, around the day and night.
sentences.chinese: 一个个都把自己整得像个陀螺，没日没夜的转悠。

sentences.english: They are still working twenty-four seven!
sentences.chinese: 他们还是没日没夜的工作。

definition: night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
without stopping to sleep or have a rest (idiom)
day and night/round-the-clock
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to stay up through the night (idiom)
overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
to leave early and return late (idiom)
lit. to continuously revolve/to work non-stop/to work around the clock (idiom)
to tire oneself out through overwork/to work oneself to death
see 起早貪黑|起早贪黑[qi3 zao3 tan1 hei1]
all day long/whole day
the whole night/all through the night
one's utmost/(to fight or work) desperately hard/to put up a life or death struggle/at all costs
to be sleepless all night
(coll.) all day long/all the time
